  "description": "Karsto Global Resources Limited is a wholly owned indigenous Oil and Gas Company located in Port Harcourt and established with a view to rendering quality onshore/offshore services in the West African sub-region.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement &amp; Logistics Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly qualified Logistics Officer to join our team.
	As a Logistics Officer, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and coordinating all aspects of logistical operations, ensuring the efficient flow of goods, materials, and resources.
	You are also required to manage transportation, warehousing, inventory control, and the timely delivery of goods in a safe and timely manner.


Main task and Responsibilities


	Responsible for planning, purchasing, receiving and delivering of materials to client.
	Undertake route planning, taking into consideration passenger needs and traffic conditions.
	Collect and deliver materials, staffs and clients to and from their required destination.
	Responsible for the cleaning and maintaining of their vehicles in a clean and tidy condition.
	Report any accidents and vehicle damage, and possible offences under the Road Traffic Acts as well as all matters affecting the efficiency and day-to-day running of the transport service.
	Ensure that the company vehicle is in order before embarking on any journey.
	Track goods and personnel movement.
	Develop and confirm schedules.
	Stop any work that can potentially harm people, assets or the environment.
	Coordinate deliveries, vehicles, loads and journeys.
	Plan for and negotiate technical difficulties.
	Prepare all necessary paperwork for each journey/delivery.
	Liaise with staff when the need arises.
	Monitor the status of incoming supplies, and correspondence with suppliers.
	Liaise with users/customers in order to organize reception of goods. If goods are not going directly to user/customer, the assistant will organize safe reception in the organization&rsquo;s warehouses.
	Liaise with Material Controller to receive goods.
	Ensure proper and timely mobilization and demobilisation of materials as required.
	Inspect goods before project commencement to give report.
	Monthly inspection of materials with Material Controller and HSE Department.
	Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in accordance with procedures.
	Make and receive waybill.
	Take charge of inventory.
	Service equipment and tools.


Requirements / Qualifications


	At least 3 years of progressively responsible experience in logistics operations.
	Degree in Distribution, Logistics, Transportation, or any relevant discipline.
	Proven working experience in a similar role in an organization within Lagos State.
	Conversant knowledge of routes in Lagos and its environs.
	Strong knowledge of road safety rules and regulations.
	Valid driver&rsquo;s license.
	Should reside in Lekki Phase 1 or its environ


Abilities:


	Ability to handle long-distance trips and meet tight deadlines.
	Good communication skills, both written and oral.
	Good team working skills.
	Good problem-solving skills.
	Good attention to details.
	Good record-keeping and organisational skills.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision.
	Good negotiating and motivation skills.
	Ability to work under pressure.
	Good Microsoft Office skills.
	Strength and stamina to spend a lot of time standing and lifting heavy packages.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;offixrecruit@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

	Ability to work with minimal supervision.

  "description": "Tune Afrique is a&nbsp;digital music distributor with a team of passionate and experienced Music enthusiasts. Wherever the next innovation in online music distribution is, we&#39;ll find it and make it easier for your to get your music out there, heard and sold as soon as possible.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Creative Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Ikeja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Production &amp; Filming:


	Lead cinematography for music videos, short-form digital content, interviews, and EPKs.
	Collaborate with directors, producers, artists, and creative teams to execute the visual vision.
	Set up and operate cameras, lighting rigs, drones, and stabilizers for on-location and studio shoots.
	Ensure high production value while adapting to various budget levels.


Pre-Production Planning:&nbsp;


	Participate in creative briefings and script breakdowns.
	Scout locations and conduct technical recces (site visits).
	Assist in shot listing, storyboard development, and lighting plans.
	Advise on gear selection and technical feasibility during planning.


Visual Style &amp; Brand Consistency:


	Develop distinct visual styles that align with artist branding and campaign tone.
	Maintain consistency in lighting, framing, and motion across content types.
	Adapt visual treatments for platforms like YouTube, TikTok, Instagram Reels, and DSPs.


Post-Production Collaboration:


	Work closely with editors, colorists, and VFX artists to ensure the final output aligns with the filmed material.
	Provide footage logs and camera reports to streamline editing workflows.
	Occasionally support rough edits or provide input during grading.


Asset &amp; Equipment Management:


	Maintain and manage camera and lighting equipment inventory.
	Ensure footage is backed up and archived properly post-shoot.
	Manage permissions, location releases, and safety protocols during production.


Position Summary


	The Digital Creative Executive is responsible for crafting compelling, high-quality visual content to support artists, labels, and brand campaigns within the digital music distribution ecosystem. This includes music videos, live sessions, promotional content, social media reels, behind-the-scenes shoots, and branded creative assets.
	The role demands technical expertise, a strong visual storytelling sense, and a deep understanding of contemporary music culture.

	3+ years of experience as a cinematographer, creative content role, preferably in music/media or digital publishing.
	Basic knowledge of post-production workflows (Premiere, DaVinci Resolve, Final Cut Pro).
	Expert in natural and artificial lighting setups for various environments.
	Familiarity with gimbals, sliders, drones, and other cinematic gear.
	Experience filming live sessions, behind-the-scenes, or docu-style content..
	Understanding of social-first content creation (Reels, Shorts, TikTok).
	Great interpersonal skills - comfortable working with artists and non-technical stakeholders.


Salary
